# BrainNetworksInPython

[![Join the chat at https://gitter.im/WhitakerLab/BrainNetworksInPython](https://badges.gitter.im/WhitakerLab/BrainNetworksInPython.svg)](https://gitter.im/WhitakerLab/BrainNetworksInPython?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge) [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/WhitakerLab/BrainNetworksInPython.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/WhitakerLab/BrainNetworksInPython)

BrainNetworksInPython is a toolkit to analyse structural covariance networks using python.  

---
### Welcome!



### What's it for?

Graph theory allows us to analyse human brain images as a network. The most popular toolbox to do brain network analyses is written in Matlab (Brain Connectivity Toolbox; https://sites.google.com/site/bctnet) which requires an expensive (and therefore inaccessible) license. We want to provide free and openly available software to allow all neuroscience researchers to conduct reproducible investigations of the human brain.

Here's an [attempt](http://splasho.com/upgoer5/?) to explain that in the ten hundred most common English words
